definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: He had cleared off his ill-humour at Randalls.
sentences.chinese: 他已经在兰得尔清除了他的坏脾气。

sentences.english: Some bad-tempered members shouted at the chairman during the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 一些坏脾气的会员在会议期间向主席叫喊。

sentences.english: But bilious outbursts and business success often go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 但坏脾气往往与商业上的成功并肩而行。

sentences.english: Dad, I since the childhood to you are filled with hate, I hate you the flip-side of bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸我从小对你充满怨恨，我讨厌你那暴躁的坏脾气。

sentences.english: Mr Jobs has shared his spleen around over the years.
sentences.chinese: 乔布斯的坏脾气年头已经不小。

sentences.english: Are you living with a grumpy spouse or partner?
sentences.chinese: 你在和坏脾气的配偶或情人生活在一起吗？

sentences.english: His bad temper chased his friends away.
sentences.chinese: 他的坏脾气使朋友们都离他而去。

sentences.english: I will keep my ill-humour to myself.
sentences.chinese: 我会克制住我的坏脾气的。

sentences.english: Paradoxically, voters' grumpiness may be a spur for radical change.
sentences.chinese: 矛盾的是，选民的坏脾气可能激发根本的变革。

sentences.english: The cantankerous bus driver rouse on the children for singing.
sentences.chinese: 那个坏脾气的公共汽车司机因为孩子们唱歌而骂他们。

sentences.english: She attributed  his bad temper to ill health.
sentences.chinese: 她把他的坏脾气归咎于健康不佳。

sentences.english: She coaxed him out of his bad temper.
sentences.chinese: 她循循善诱地劝他改掉坏脾气。

sentences.english: My bad temper, you asks, but already knows.
sentences.chinese: 我的坏脾气，你明知故问。

sentences.english: What food easy cause bad temper?
sentences.chinese: 哪些食物易引起坏脾气？

sentences.english: He had a temper as bad as a bull.
sentences.chinese: 他有着公牛一样的坏脾气。

sentences.english: But unfortunately he had his failings too: laziness and a love of tippling .
sentences.chinese: 可惜他又有一样坏脾气，便是好喝懒做。

definition: to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
